body_html: @soumith Not really. The purpose of requires_grad_() is mainly to replace the pattern Variable(x.data, requires_grad=True). It should be used as x.data.requires_grad_() or x.detach().requires_grad_(). requires_grad_ itself only sets the flag, and doesn't detach. (That's why you can do things like requries_grad_(False).)

body: @soumith Not really. The purpose of `requires_grad_()` is mainly to replace the pattern `Variable(x.data, requires_grad=True)`. It should be used as `x.data.requires_grad_()` or `x.detach().requires_grad_()`. `requires_grad_` itself only sets the flag, and doesn't detach. (That's why you can do things like `requries_grad_(False)`.)
